medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient has a 12-year history of progressive limb weakness, starting with difficulty climbing stairs and later having trouble getting up from a chair. Over the preceding 2 years, combing her hair became difficult. She also experienced hip and shoulder pain. Symptoms have progressively worsened without any reported eyelid drooping, double vision, or bulbar symptoms.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father and paternal uncle developed leg weakness in their early 40s and were diagnosed with limb-girdle muscular dystrophy (LGMD). An older brother and her uncleâ€™s son also developed leg weakness in their early 40s and were diagnosed with LGMD, both died in their mid-to-late 50s due to respiratory failure. The brother had peripheral neuropathy.
